Strong tendency of [[reanalysis]]  

Strong tendency of [[right]] [[reverse]] reading amplified in  
ğ’²ğ’‹›ğ’‰† Î´Î¹ÎºÎ±Î¹Î¿ÏƒÏÎ½Î· dikaiosÃºnÄ“ "righteousness" ğ’‰†ğ’‹›ğ’²  

If ğ’‰† nam is read phonetically and not just a grammatical marker it makes Sumerian decidedly unfamiliar Â¬PIE  
If ğ’‰† sim is read phonetically as sym- syn- it makes Sumerian decidedly familiar PIE  

Both may be true: An unfamiliar Sumerian marker might have influenced a PIE prefix.  

ğ’‰† nam phonetically as ablaut marker?
